overview: Chris co-founded the Assay Depot. His last position was head of software development at Kalypsys, where he led efforts to design and develop custom software tools that improve drug discovery efficiency. Prior to Kalypsys, he was director of engineering at Learning Framework where he oversaw development of their flagship product, the Socrates Learning Performance Management System. He has led software development teams in industries ranging from streaming video to customer management. Chris received a B.S. degree in Computer Science in 1999 from Worcester Polytechnic Institute, where he received the Provost’s award for work in evolutionary programming and genetic algorithms.
